intro: Nilgirianthus ciliatus, commonly known as the Nilgiri bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance. Nilgirianthus ciliatus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
